bill_title: Requesting South Dakota's congressional delegation to support federal legislation to maintain the automated flight service station in Huron as staffed by federal air traffic control flight service specialists.

bill_versions.bill_text: A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, Requesting South Dakota's congressional delegation to support federal legislation to maintain the flight service station in Huron as staffed by federal air traffic control flight service specialists. WHEREAS, the closing of the Huron Flight Service Station would leave the State of South Dakota without any flight services based in the state; and WHEREAS, a key function of the Huron Flight Service Station is to provide weather briefings, and according to the National Transportation Safety Board, six hundred ninety-seven fatal flight accidents in the United States between 1995 and 2000 were weather related; and WHEREAS, the privatization and subsequent closing of the Huron Flight Service Station would negatively impact pilots and passengers by forcing pilots to rely on information from individuals not familiar with the geography and the rapidly changing and diverse weather conditions in South Dakota; and WHEREAS, the citizens of this geographically large state depend on the safety of air service for personal, commercial, business, and medical purposes; and WHEREAS, the specialists at the flight service are trained in air emergencies, NOTAM information, initiation of search and rescue, flight planning, and weather; and WHEREAS, as South Dakota citizens, the specialists at the flight service are intimately familiar with the vast array of small towns, air strips, and diverse geography throughout South Dakota; and WHEREAS, the specialists at the flight service are an integral component of the South Dakota homeland security plan; and WHEREAS, the community of Huron will be greatly impacted by the loss of thirty federal employees: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Eightieth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the South Dakota Legislature requests our congressional delegation to support the maintenance of the Huron Flight Service Station as currently staffed.

A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, Requesting South Dakota's congressional delegation to support federal legislation to maintain the automated flight service station in Huron as staffed by federal air traffic control flight service specialists. WHEREAS, the closing of the Huron Automated Flight Service Station would leave the State of South Dakota without any flight services based in the state; and WHEREAS, a key function of the Huron Automated Flight Service Station is to provide weather briefings, and according to the National Transportation Safety Board, six hundred ninety-seven fatal flight accidents in the United States between 1995 and 2000 were weather related; and WHEREAS, the privatization and subsequent closing of the Huron Automated Flight Service Station would negatively impact pilots and passengers by forcing pilots to rely on information from individuals not familiar with the geography and the rapidly changing and diverse weather conditions in South Dakota; and WHEREAS, the citizens of this geographically large state depend on the safety of air service for personal, commercial, business, and medical purposes; and WHEREAS, the specialists at the flight service are trained in air emergencies, NOTAM information, initiation of search and rescue, flight planning, and weather; and WHEREAS, as South Dakota citizens, the specialists at the flight service are intimately familiar with the vast array of small towns, air strips, and diverse geography throughout South Dakota; and WHEREAS, the specialists at the flight service are an integral component of the South Dakota homeland security plan; and WHEREAS, the community of Huron will be greatly impacted by the loss of thirty federal employees: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Eightieth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that the South Dakota Legislature requests our congressional delegation to support the maintenance of the Huron Automated Flight Service Station as currently staffed.
